meanings.def: a straight tree with a mass of long leaves at the top, growing in tropical countries. There are several types of palm tree, some of which produce fruit.
the inner surface of the hand between the wrist and the fingers
examples: He held the bird gently in the palm of his hand.
to read somebody’s palm (= to say what you think will happen to somebody by looking at the lines on their palm)
He rubbed his palms against his jeans.
He showed me the coins in his palm.
He spread his palms in a gesture of openness.
He took her hand between his palms and squeezed it.
His right palm was resting against my neck.
Hold out your arms with the palms facing downwards.
She held out her hand to me, palm up.

meanings.def: to give somebody money so that they will do you a favour, especially tell your fortune
to give somebody money in order to persuade them to do something dishonest
to have complete control or influence over somebody
examples: Even before he plays a note, he has the audience in the palm of his hand.
